page.title: 07Farming
page.content: Farming and its subsidiaries was and is the main source of employment in the area.Today the farms do not need many workers except for seasonal helpers for fruit picking.Many buyers come to pick their own strawberries, raspberries and blackcurrants. Temporary car parks are made in the fields.Two farms specialise in soft fruits - one as a main activity, one as a subsidiary. There are a number of small farms in Bilbrough and Colton.The chief crops are barley and wheat, although oil seed rape, potatoes and sugar beet are grown.There are two dairy farms, one in Bilbrough and one in Colton.The latter supplies local needs.One Bilbrough farmer has intensified pig production.The agricultural college has land for cereal experimentation.
